message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I think you'll really love. I'm willing to let it go for $250.
I'm really interested in the product, but $250 is a bit out of my budget. I'd be willing to pay $180 for it.
I understand you're looking to save some money, Bob. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I still need to make a profit. I'm now offering the product for $220.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'd be willing to pay $200 for the product.
I'm starting to feel like we're getting close, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession, but I still need to make a profit. I'm now offering the product for $210.
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'd be willing to pay $190 for the product.

I'm getting a bit concerned that we're getting too far apart, Bob. However, I'm still willing to negotiate. I'm now offering the product for $200, which is right in the middle of our last two offers. Let's meet in the middle!
I appreciate your willingness to meet us in the middle, but I'm still trying to save a bit of money. I'd be willing to pay $195 for the product.

I'm starting to think we're getting close, but I still need to make a decent profit. I'm now offering the product for $205, which is just $5 more than your last offer. Let's see if we can finalize the deal.
I'm willing to meet you at $200, which is the same as your previous offer. I'm not willing to go any higher, so I'd be willing to pay $200 for the product.
